alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:37PM EST until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Calhoun, Liberty, Franklin and Gulf Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur at Douglas Landing and Willis Landing Campgrounds in Gulf County. The 19.0 ft level at Blountstown may at times not be representative of river levels in these areas due to tidal effects, winds, or local rainfall and should be used with caution. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CST Wednesday /9:15 PM EST Wednesday/ the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 19.1 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 01/22/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 300 PM CST /400 PM EST/.
